25708781.trustfund: TF054586-PHRD-CHINA: RURAL HEALTH PROJECT,TF092893-CHINA RURAL HEALTH PROJECT (RECIPIENT-EXECUTED),TF092906-CHINA RURAL HEALTH PROJECT (BANK-EXECUTED)

abstracts.cdata!:
The Rural Health Project for China had a
            satisfactory outcome with low and negligible risk to
            development outcome, moderately satisfactory performance by
            the Bank, and satisfactory performance by the borrower. The
            lessons learned were: (1) the project was able to capitalize
            the existence of a policy environment favorable to rural
            health reform and push the envelope, delving into difficult
            issues such as provider payment and incentives. (2) The
            implementation of a complex reform project in such a large
            number of counties and provinces undermined the
            effectiveness of the project. (3) Capacity building and
            strategic thinking has enhanced the project’s impact and its
            long-term sustainability. (4) The Results Framework should
            include lower level indicators that can be regularly
            monitored using routine data from the management information
            system. (5) By focusing on evaluation, documentation and
            dissemination of experiences, results and lessons learned,
            the project transferred knowledge and fostered a culture of
            evidence-based decision-making.

17960422.admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific
17960422.theme: Rural services and infrastructure,Health system performance
17960422.trustfund:
TF054586-PHRD-CHINA: RURAL HEALTH PROJECT,TF092906-CHINA RURAL HEALTH PROJECT (BANK-EXECUTED),TF092893-CHINA RURAL HEALTH PROJECT (RECIPIENT-EXECUTED),TF092654-JAPAN CTF - FY09: GENERAL BBMC
            (ALL BANK BORROWING MEMBER COUNTRIES/ALL

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Rural Health
            Project for China is to increased and more equitable access
            to quality health services, improved financial protection,
            and better management of public health threats in pilot
            provinces and counties, with lessons to support reforms in
            non-project areas. This restructuring is to: (a) extend the
            closing date (as a first extension) by one year from
            December 31, 2013 to December 31, 2014; this will allow
            sufficient time for the project to complete the latest
            pilots, carry out evaluations of the new pilots, and
            disseminate and roll out to non-piloting areas; (b) remove
            the reference of National Validation Panel (NPV) in the loan
            agreement, and replace it with the National Expert Panel
            (NEP) as the NEP has been carrying out this function over
            the course of the project; and (c) revise the definition of
            indicator 17 to better align and assess the progress of
            implementation on the ground.

display_title.display_title:
China - Rural Health Project :
            restructuring (Vol. 2) : Data sheet
